name: ldap
description:
Provides an interface to LDAP Lightweight Directory Access Protocol
directory servers like the Netscape Directory Server.

params.name: returnasbinary
params.description: A comma-delimited list of columns that are to be returned as binary values.

params.name: server
params.description: Host name "biff.upperlip.com" or IP address "192.1.2.225" of the LDAP server.

params.name: port
params.description: Port defaults to the standard LDAP port, 389.

params.name: usetls
params.description: use a secure connection. (but try secure="CFSSL_BASIC" instead)

params.name: username
params.description: If no user name is specified, the LDAP connection is anonymous.

params.name: secure
params.description:
The type of security to use

- CFSSL_BASIC
- CFSSL_CLIENT_AUTH

params.name: password
params.description: used when username is defined

params.name: action
params.description:
Specifies the LDAP action.

- add
- delete
- modifydn
- modify
- query

params.name: name
params.description: The name you assign to the LDAP query.

params.name: timeout
params.description:
Specifies the maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait for LDAP processing. Defaults to
60 seconds.

params.name: maxrows
params.description: Specifies the maximum number of entries for LDAP queries.

params.name: start
params.description: Specifies the distinguished name of the entry to be used to start the search.

params.name: scope
params.description:
Specifies the scope of the search from the entry specified in the Start attribute
for action = "Query".

params.name: attributes
params.description:
Required if action = "Query", "Add", "ModifyDN", or "Modify"
For queries: comma-delimited list of attributes to return. For
queries, to get all attributes, specify "*".

If action = "add" or "modify", you can specify a list of update
columns. Separate attributes with a semicolon.

If action = "ModifyDN", CFML passes attributes to the
LDAP server without syntax checking.

params.name: filter
params.description:
Search criteria for action = "Query".

List attributes in the form:
"(attribute operator value)" Example: "(sn = Smith)"

params.name: filterfile
params.description: this attribute is deprecated and no longer supported.

params.name: sort
params.description: Indicates the attribute or attributes by which to sort query results. Use a comma to separate attributes.

params.name: sortcontrol
params.description: Specifies how to sort query results.

params.name: dn
params.description: Specifies the distinguished name for update actions.

params.name: startrow
params.description:
Used in conjunction with action = "Query". Specifies the first row of the LDAP query to insert
into the query. The default is 1.

params.name: modifytype
params.description: Indicates whether to add, delete, or replace an attribute in a multi-value list of attributes.

params.name: rebind
params.description:
If you set rebind to Yes, cfldap attempts to rebind the referral callback and reissue the query
by the referred address using the original credentials. The default is No, which means referred
connections are anonymous.

params.name: referral
params.description: Number of hops allowed in a referral. A value of 0 disables referred addresses for LDAP; no data is returned.

params.name: separator
params.description:
Specifies the character that cfldap uses to separate attribute values in multi-value attributes. This character is used by the query, add, and modify action attributes, and
by cfldap to output multi-value attributes. The default character is the comma (,).

params.name: delimiter
params.description:
Specifies the character that cfldap uses to separate multiple attribute name/value pairs when more than one attribute is specified in the attribute attribute or the attribute that you want to use has the default delimiter character, which is the semicolon (;), such as mgrpmsgrejecttext;lang-en. The delimiter character is used by the query, add, and
modify action attributes, and is used by cfldap to output multi-value attributes
